item.title: Trump and Zelensky talk peace while Putin wages war
item.description: Ukraine peace won’t come until the Russian dictator realizes he can’t win militarily.

item.title: The epidemic of toxic flattery is spreading
item.description: What do AI, Trump’s cabinet and the academy have in common? They aim to please.

item.title: What kind of skilled immigrants does America need? You decide.
item.description: The government is now prioritizing visas for foreign workers who make higher wages.

item.title: China is using American AI against the U.S. Here’s how to stop it.
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party promotes its authoritarian agenda via U.S. technology.

item.title: The U.S. vaccine schedule is a jet engine. Denmark’s is a toy plane.
item.description: Replacing the U.S. vaccine schedule with one like Denmark’s would be negligence.

item.title: States made marijuana use legal. Now they should get it off the road.
item.description: There’s no breathalyzer test for driving under the influence of cannabis. But there are other options.

item.title: To appreciate new ‘Frankenstein’ creations, read the correct version
item.description: Even Mary Shelley rewrote her own work; two very different versions survive today.

item.title: Football has become a human wrecking ball. It doesn’t have to be.
item.description: Readers respond to Post articles and commentary.

item.title: Every family has a history. Here’s how to make sure it’s handed down.
item.description: What happens when the children are the historians.

item.title: The Epstein files fiasco was completely foreseeable
item.description: A document dump betrays the Justice Department’s mission, but bipartisan pressure demanded one.

item.title: Ben Sasse is exiting the stage far too soon
item.description: The former Republican senator from Nebraska announced last week he has Stage 4 pancreatic cancer.
